body_html: I see your point. But is the cmake feature still relevant? The reason I ask, is that in the 1.10 release notes it was stated the following: "Starting from TensorFlow 1.11, Windows builds will use Bazel. Therefore, we will drop official support for cmake."
body_text: I see your point. But is the cmake feature still relevant? The reason I ask, is that in the 1.10 release notes it was stated the following: "Starting from TensorFlow 1.11, Windows builds will use Bazel. Therefore, we will drop official support for cmake."
body: I see your point. But is the cmake feature still relevant? The reason I ask, is that in the 1.10 release notes it was stated the following: "Starting from TensorFlow 1.11, Windows builds will use Bazel. Therefore, we will drop official support for cmake."
